page.title: 07The Blackwell Influence
page.content: Mr. and Mrs. Nigel Blackwell live at the Grange next to the Church. Other members of the famous publishing family live in the area. They bought the Manor House in a state of disrepair and completely restored it. Fyfield Manor c.1320, with its beautiful solar room has housed Blackwells Rare Books Department for the past six years. There is a staff of thirteen who live within a twenty mile radius. Swift is reputed to have stayed there and derived the name Gulliver from Golafre. It houses about 20,000 volumes (18,000 rare, 2,000 reference). A modern presses section includes small handmade editions and first editions by famous authors. Many are sold abroad by mail order and the Manor attracts distinguished foreign visitors and locals are always welcome.
